user.biography:
🌍 Where feminism and environmentalism come together.
🌿 Check out our hemp underwear brand @magithelabel!
👩‍💻 Created by @nergizdebaere

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This is my message to the western world- your civilisation is killing life on Earth." Nemonte Nenquimo NemonteNenquimo Nenquimo 1/7'.

node.text:
The Earth needs respecting, not saving. 

Slides by @earthrise.studio 🌎

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021 tagging @earthrise.studio. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This is my message to the western world- your civilisation is killing life on Earth." Nemonte Nenquimo NemonteNenquimo Nenquimo 1/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise "As Indigenous peoples, we are fighting to protect what we love -our way of life, our rivers, the animals, our forests, life on Earth -and it's time that you listened to us." Source:Nemontenquimo.(2020).The Guardian. 2/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'earthrise "It took us thousands of years to get to know the Amazon rainforest. To understand her ways, her secrets, to learn how to survive and thrive with her." "When you say that you are urgently looking for climate solutions, yet continue to build a world economy based on extraction and pollution, we know you are lying because we are the closest to the land, and the first to hear her cries." Source:NemonteNnquimo.(2020) The Guardian. 3/7'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 4 people and text.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "In all these years of taking taking, taking from our lands, you have not had the courage, or the curiosity, or the respect to get to know us.' "To understand how we see, and think, and feel, and what we know about life on this Earth." .:qu.(2020). The Guardian. 5/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person and text that says 'earthrise "This forest has taught us how to walk lightly, and because we have listened, learned and defended her, she has given us everything." "And you are taking all this away, not just from us, out from everyone on the planet, and from future generations." Soure.Nene.(2020)The Guardian. 6/7'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 30, 2021. May be an image of 1 person, outdoors and text that says 'earthrise "And so say to all of you: the Earth does not expect you to save her, she expects you to respect her. And we, as Indigenous_peoples expect the same. Soure.N2.a 7/7'.

node.text:
Left to its own devices, capitalism is destructive because it only prioritises economic growth. But we are finite human beings living on a finite planet. That’s why we need to correct for capitalism’s shortcomings by implementing policies that enact climate and social justice. 

If you’ve ever wondered about the link between capitalism and climate change, have a swipe through! As always, I encourage you to do your own deeper research as this is a very complicated topic. Think of this as dipping your toe into it 🛁 

Data about political donations is from Reuters 🔎

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'CAPITALISM ONLY PRIORITISES SHORT TERM PROFITS. There is no framework within capitalism to prioritise social or environmental interests only economic profits. Capitalism is incompatible with climate justice because it relies on exploitation and wielding power over both people and planet. Î T w -G-R-O CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'EXTRACTING AND BURNING FOSSIL FUELS FOR PROFIT HAS CAUSED CLIMATE CHANGE AS WE KNOW IT. Capitalism has improved many lives, but it has also destroyed many others'. Indigenous people in the US and Canada have been forcibly moved away from ancestral lands to make room for coal digging. Communities in the Pacific have been dealing with rising sea levels and poisonous oil spills. There isn't enough room on an Instagram slide to name the many other horrors inflicted by capitalism. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of money and text that says 'BECAUSE CAPITALISM DOESN'T FACTOR IN THE COST THE ENVIRONMENT, GOVERNMENTS HAVE TO FACTOR IT IN INSTEAD. But governments don't want to, because they're often heavily influenced by businesses that pollute the environment- either by lobbying or campaign donations. For example in the 2020 US Presidential election, U.S. oil and gas companies poured million political spending. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 28, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'GOVERNMENTS NEED TO: .TAX CARBON DECARBONISE THE ECONOMY SUBSIDISE ELECTRIC VEHICLES .PUNISH ECOCIDE IMPLEMENT A UNIVERSAL BASIC INCOME INTRODUCE A FOUR DAY WORKING WEEK CHICKS CLIMATE'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'AIR POLLUTION CAN AFFECT OUR MENTAL HEALTH CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

node.text:
There is no healthy level of air pollution. So why aren’t governments stepping up and protecting our lungs and our mental health? Who else is tired of the stalling? 😴

Source: The Guardian

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'AIR POLLUTION CAN AFFECT OUR MENTAL HEALTH CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'CUTTING AIR POLLUTION WON'T JUST BE GOOD FOR OUR LUNGS. A new study conducted in London shows that a small increase in exposure to nitrogen dioxide leads to a 32% increase in the risk of needing community- based treatment for mental health. Research also shows that increases in air pollution are linked to depression, anxiety and even decreases in intelligence. FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 27, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'HOW CAN WE CUT AIR POLLUTION? governments can do Subsidise electric cars Tax carbon -Regulate pollution in factories and other industry Enforce pollution limits on gas cars What you can do .Try to bike or walk if you can, or use public transport Ask your local representative to enforce the above CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of sky and text that says 'THIS COMPANY IS REVERSING CLIMATE CHANGE AND TURNING SCI-FI INTO REALITY BY MAKING DIFFERENT PRODUCTS FROM JUST: AIR (CO2) WATER & SUNLIGHT AIR COMPANY® CLIMATE CHICKS CLIMATE'.

node.text: Carbon capture and utilisation will be a part of the green transition, and companies like @aircompany are doing just that by creating products of the future, made entirely from CO2, water and sunlight. How cool is that?! ☁️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of sky and text that says 'THIS COMPANY IS REVERSING CLIMATE CHANGE AND TURNING SCI-FI INTO REALITY BY MAKING DIFFERENT PRODUCTS FROM JUST: AIR (CO2) WATER & SUNLIGHT AIR COMPANY® CLIMATE CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of text that says 'HOW DOES IT WORK? Air Company takes carbon dioxide from a point source. Carbon dioxide and water are broken down and reformed to produce high- purity alcohols with oxygen as the only byproduct. Renewable energy is used to power the process, which is entirely carbon negative. AIR COMPANY CHICKS CLIMATE CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of text that says 'A BETTER APPROACH TO CARBON CAPTURE Current carbon mitigation efforts overwhelmingly focus on planting trees. But humans are emitting carbon at a rate that is too fast for trees to keep up with. Carbon capture and utilization (CCU) technologies, which turns carbon into usable materials, is growing in popularity as a faster way of removing carbon from the atmosphere. Itis necessary for these technologies to exist in order to reverse climate change. AIR COMPANY. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of text that says 'CARBON EMISSIONS ARE THE HIGHEST THEY'VE BEEN IN 23 MILLION YEARS. CARBON CAPTURE, UTILIZATION AND STORAGE PROJECTS COULD REDUCE GLOBAL CARBON DIOXIDE EMISSIONS BY ALMOST A FIFTH AND REDUCE THE COST OF TACKLING THE CLIMATE CRISIS BY 70%. AIR COMPANY. CHICKS CLIMAT'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 24, 2021 tagging @aircompany. May be an image of bottle and text that says 'C.O VODKA AIR C.O HANDSANITIZER AIR VODKA AIR SPRAY The world's cleanest, highest quality and most sustainable spirit. Gluten free, sugar free, impurity free, carbohydrate-free. An ultra-refined, carbon- negative antibacterial spray that protects against germs while improving the air we breathe. A pack will be donated for every one sold. AIR COMPANY. CHICKS CLIMATE'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 22, 2021 tagging @graphicsandgrain, and @intersectionalenvironmentalist. May be an image of text that says 'W E NEED BEEK BEES @intersectionalenvironmentalist'.

node.text:
We can thank bees for all the different varieties of fruits and vegetables we have, for the plants and flowers that decorate our planet and for the planet’s food system to be able to operate. 🐝 

Let’s not take them for granted. The more we use pesticides, the more we warm the planet and the more we cut down bees’ habitats, the more bees we lose. 😔 

Graphics by @graphicsandgrain from @intersectionalenvironmentalist ☁️

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 22, 2021 tagging @graphicsandgrain, and @intersectionalenvironmentalist. May be an image of text that says 'W E NEED BEEK BEES @intersectionalenvironmentalist'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 22, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'We need bees. Honey bees are perfectly adapted to pollinate, helping plants grow, breed and produce food. They do so by transferring pollen between flowering plants and therefore keeping the cycle of life turning. We may take them and other pollinators for granted, but they' vital to a stable, healthy food supply. The United Nations Food and Agriculture Organization identified encouraging pollina- tors tors- particularly bees as one of the best sustainable ways to boost food security and support sustainable farming @intersectionalenvironmentalist'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 22, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'WHAT CAN YOU DO TO HELP THE BEES? Spread awareness on social media! Stop using dangerous pesticides that harm bees Make a bee-friendly garden Support local beekeepers Support bee conservation efforts through raising awareness, funds, or signal boosting If necessary, opt for humane bee removal options @intersectionalenvironmentalist'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021 tagging @atmos. May be an image of text that says 'The_Frontlne Frontline D Atmos We asked four climate leaders for advice Here's what they had to say after that sobering IPCC report'.

node.text: A beacon of hope from @atmos 💜🌍 we’re all in this together, and we can fix this together.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021 tagging @atmos. May be an image of text that says 'The_Frontlne Frontline D Atmos We asked four climate leaders for advice Here's what they had to say after that sobering IPCC report'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The Frontline Atmos " "Know Better, Do Better" Mustafa Santiago Ali VP Envromentl Justice at the National Wildlife Federation How do you deal with climate anxiety? "I'm writing a lot more both music and poetry. Also, when get a chance, watching and listening to comedy because it helps to soothe the soul and to disconnect for a moment. spend a lot more time talking with family and surrounding myself with youthful energy. When can, spend as much time in nature- whether it's next to a lake or a river or walking on a trail."'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The Frontline Atmos "Our Actions Really Matter" Kate Marvel Research Scientist at Columbia University and NASA How do you deal with climate anxiety? "I have a lot of feelings about climate change. I've got kids, so I've obviously made a bet about how this is all going to shake out. think the thing that provokes anxiety is the uncertainty but the thing that can provoke action is the uncertainty. It is so important to know that we don't know the end of this. What that means is that our actions really matter.''.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The Frontline Atmos "Work Like It's Climate Change" Elizabeth Yeampierre Executive Director of UPROSE How do you deal with climate anxiety? "For me not to be anxious, have to feel like I'm being purposeful. have an addiction to K-drama, and that's what do when don't want to think of anything. try to make sure that set some time aside every single day not to turn on the TV and listen to the news or anything that is going to trigger that anxiety that always feel in my stomach."'.
Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 16, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'The Frontline Atmos And finally... What advice do they have for the rest of us? 1. Feel your feelings. 2. Figure out your superpower and identify what skills or talents you can lend to the movement. 3. Do something (big or small) every single day that makes you feel like you're contributing. 4. Call your representatives and demand climate action. 5. Check out local community organizations. You're not alone!'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE TOP 10% OF CARBON EMITTERS (WHO ARE ALSO THE RICHEST CONTRIBUTE BETWEEN 36 AND 45% OF GLOBAL EMISSIONS. THIS IS 10 TIMES AS MUCH AS THE POOREST 10%. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

node.text:
More than 102 million people in the US are in the top 10% worldwide.

The richest 10% also own 85% of global wealth. If we are going to have any chance of fixing this climate crisis, we have to address inequality and enact justice for those who have contributed the least and are suffering the most.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE TOP 10% OF CARBON EMITTERS (WHO ARE ALSO THE RICHEST CONTRIBUTE BETWEEN 36 AND 45% OF GLOBAL EMISSIONS. THIS IS 10 TIMES AS MUCH AS THE POOREST 10%. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 13, 2021. May be an image of money and text that says '0 000'005 ANYONE WHO HAS A NET WORTH OF $93 170 USD OR ABOVE IS IN THE TOP 10% OF THE WORLD. CHICKS CHI CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 13, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SOURCES: Greenhouse gas emissions must peak within 4 years, says leaked UN report, The Guardian •How much money you need to be among the richest 10 percent of people worldwide, CNBC CNBC CHICKS CHICK CLIMATE FOR'.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 10, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE EARTH IS PROJECTED TO HIT 1.5 DEGREES OF WARMING BY 2030 This will happen in all 5 scenarios, ranging from highly optimistic to reckless, modelled by the report. Reaching this threshold will happen a full decade earlier than previously thought. If we do everything right, we can go back down to 1.4 degrees c by 2100. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 10, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'EARTH'S NATURAL PROTECTIONS ARE REACHING THEIR LIMIT Since 1960, forests, soil and oceans have absorbed 56 percent of all the CO2 released by humanity. .These natural carbon sinks are losing their ability to soak up our carbon as we continue to destroy them. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 10, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SEAS ARE RISING HIGHER MORE QUICKLY Oceans around the world have risen about 20 centimetres (eight inches) since 1900, and the rate of increase has nearly tripled in the last decade. Scientists can't rule out a 2m rise (worst-case scenario) by the end of this century. CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 10, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'METHANE IS GETTING MORE ATTENTION Methane emissions largely come from agriculture (livestock and manure and hg waste disposal fuel production. Methane levels are their highest in at least 800,000 years. CHICKS CH CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 10, 2021. May be an image of text that says '"Immediate, rapid and large-scale" cuts to greenhouse gas emissions could still help to stabilise global temperatures around the 1.5 degrees threshold. THIS MEANS WE CAN STILL AVOID THE WORST OF CLIMATE CHANGE. BUT WE HAVE TO ACT NOW. Global Varming °C CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'COST CLIMATE OF THE THE 1% of global CRISIS: TACKLING © GDP and (mtly) higher living standards *we already spend 6% of global GDP subsidising fossil fuels CHICKS FOR CLIMATE'.

node.text:
There’s zero excuse anymore for not acting on the climate crisis. Why are governments still stalling - especially when the cost of doing nothing will be so catastrophic both in terms of loss of life and financially? 

If we do act, it’s likely our living standards will be even better than before in the form of reduced air pollution and related health impact; lower energy bills for households, thanks to cheap electricity and more efficient buildings; more flexible mobility services; and higher-quality, healthier consumer goods.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'COST CLIMATE OF THE THE 1% of global CRISIS: TACKLING © GDP and (mtly) higher living standards *we already spend 6% of global GDP subsidising fossil fuels CHICKS FOR CLIMATE'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'DOING THE COST OF At least 5% of global GDP that will dwindle yearly, as well as seas rising, widespread death and sickness related to extreme weather events, droughts, food and water shortages, increased energy costs, species extinction, habitat destruction, pollution and more pandemics CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'THE LONGER WE WAIT TO TACKLE CLIMATE CHANGE, THE MORE EXPENSIVE IT WILL GET. SO GOVERNMENTS- WHY AREN'T YOU ACTING? CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 09, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'SOURCES: •Gauging Economic Consensus on Climate Change, 2021 by the Institute for Policy Integrity •Making Mission Possible: Delivering a Net Zero Economy, The Energy Transitions Commission, 2020 CHICKS CLIHAT FOR'.

Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 08, 2021 tagging @yemagz, and @wellmadeclothes_. May be an image of text that says 'Influencers Should Stop Glamourising Fast Fashion MAGGIE ZHOU WELL MADE CLOTHES'.

node.text:
This write up by @yemagz is an important one - and ultra relevant for the influencer-fuelled consumption patterns we see in the social media space. 

Influencers have huge power, often playing a direct role in collections selling out. Do we really need all the stuff influencers are pushing on us? Probably not.

Let’s not bash influencers but let’s hold the fashion brands accountable who pick and choose whom they pay fairly. Everyone deserves to get paid fairly for their work - especially the skilled workers making the clothes the influencers wear.

node.accessibility_caption: Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 08, 2021 tagging @yemagz, and @wellmadeclothes_. May be an image of text that says 'Influencers Should Stop Glamourising Fast Fashion MAGGIE ZHOU WELL MADE CLOTHES'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 08, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INFLUENCERS SHOULD STOP GLAMOURISING FAST FASHION INFLUENCERS HAVE THE POWER TO AFFECT PURCHASING DECISIONS AND VALUES OF THEIR FOLLOWERS. IT'S A POWER WE SHOULD TAKE SERIOUSLY. so WHY ARE so MANY INFLUENCERS PROMOTING FAST FASHION?'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 08, 2021. May be an image of text that says 'INFLUENCERS SHOULD STOP GLAMOURISING FAST FASHION INFLUENCERS ARE IMPERATIVE TO DRIVING AND DICTATING THE TRENDS WE SEE; THEY TAKE STYLES OFF RANKS AND ALLOW CUSTOMERS TO ENVISION WHAT LIFESTYLE COULD BE ATTAINED IF ONLY THEY JUST WORE THAT TOO.'.

IT'S NOT OUT OF NECESSITY THAT THEY PROMOTE FAST FASHION, ITIS A CHOICE.'.

"I'M so BLESSED TO WORK so CLOSELY WITH A BRAND THAT BELIEVES IN ME WHOLE HEARTEDLY [SIC]. THANK YOU PLT FOR MAKING MY DREAMS COME TRUE EVERYDAY [SIC]," MOLLY-MAE GUSHED IN AN INSTAGRAM POST. AT THE SAME TIME, PRETTY LITTLE THING (OWNED BY BOOHOO) WAS UNDER FIRE FOR PAYING WORKERS IN THEIR LEICESTER FACTORY AS LITTLE AS £3.50 AN HOUR, THE EQUIVALENT OF $6.38 AUD.'.

BRANDS SHOULDN'T PICK AND CHOOSE WHO DESERVES TO BE PAID CORRECTLY ESPECIALLY WHEN THOSE ACTUALLY PRODUCING THE GARMENTS ARE THE ONES LEFT BEHIND.'.

Photo by Chicks For Climate on August 05, 2021. May be an image of body of water and text that says 'PEOPLE ARE STILL BUYING BOTTLED WATER. AND THE ENVIRONMENTAL IMPACTS ARE 3,500X TAP WATER CHICKS CLIMATE FOR CLIMATE'.

node.text:
Even though there’s seemingly a new reusable water bottle company popping up every week, plastic water bottle usage has been rising. 

Disclaimer: This is not an invitation to shame others for drinking from water bottles, because there are some places where drinking tap water isn’t feasible or safe (check out @blackmillennials4flint for more on this). 

One possible explanation for this is that plastic water bottle companies market their products really well, and can easily greenwash by saying their bottles are recyclable. They also tout health benefits that are questionable at best - tap water usually is pretty healthy and safe to drink.

Are you surprised that bottle water usage has been increasing? 🤔

This is up 4.2 per cent from the year before. According to a poll, if bottled water wasn't available, 74 per cent of people would switch to other bottled drinks instead of tap water. Beverage Industry, "Data shows bottled water emains high demand among consumers" CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.

"H lealth and environmental impacts fdrinking water choices Barcelona, Spain: modelling study" CHICKS CLIMATE FOR'.
Photo shared by Chicks For Climate on August 04, 2021 tagging @atmos. May be an image of text that says 'Atmos We did not cause the climate crisis'.

node.text:
This caption might be one of the most important things you read all week. Via @atmos 🌎✨

“The language we use around the climate crisis can conceal as much as it reveals.

When referring to human-inflicted damage to the planet, westerners often implement a universal "we." This assumes an idea of a collective humanity destroying the Earth. In Netflix's "A Life On Our Planet," David Attenborough warned: “This is now our planet, run by humankind for humankind. We’ve not just ruined it. We’ve destroyed it.”

But these sweeping terms—"humankind," "our planet," and "we"—fail to acknowledge some important truths. For example, that carbon emissions of the world's richest 1% are more than double those of the poorest half of the world or that 100 companies are responsible for 71% of global greenhouse gas emissions. 

Black, Indigenous, and other people of color in the Global South have historically contributed the least to global heating but are at disproportionate risk from its impacts—including drought, flooding, and food insecurity. Despite comprising just 5% of the world's population, Indigenous peoples protect 80% of global biodiversity. To homogenize the global population into a collective "we" is to allow those most responsible to evade accountability. 

When we talk about human-caused ecological devastation, language and context matter. The COVID-19 pandemic has shown that disaster affects communities in different ways, and denying this is not just naive—but harmful. The same applies to the climate crisis. The most polluting should not be calling on the universal "we" to solve the catastrophe they have had such a pivotal role in producing.”

Sources: Oxfam, CDP Carbon Majors Report 2017, Center for Global Development, United Nations, Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Words by @elieoutside 
Design by @tessaforrest
